talk.author: did:plc:tbqqvyv6pjjww44glrmycaxl
talk.utter: No, i have two dogs. They stay out of the way of dogs but are not concerned by them the same way they are by cats

talk.author: did:plc:dxeb6bgiezfj5wsjdmag73bj
talk.utter: Do they steer clear of yards with cats? We have three “friendly feral” garden cats (fixed, tipped, and vetted) that don’t seem bothered by the blue jays eating their kibble.

talk.author: did:plc:tbqqvyv6pjjww44glrmycaxl
talk.utter:
Yes, they probably will avoid the yards with cats. Or harass the cats.

You can establish relationships like these with jays as well but I think crows are far more tuned to our behavior
